chapter.title: Compute API v2.1 (CURRENT)
chapter.para: This page lists the Compute API v2.1 operations in the following order:

listitem.para: Extensions in alphabetical order by resource

note.para: Effective in the OpenStack Kilo release, XML support in requests and responses was removed for the Compute API v2.1.

section.title: API versions
section.para: Lists information for all API versions.

section.title: Servers multiple create (servers)
section.para: Creates one or more servers with an optional reservation ID. The request and response examples show how to create multiple servers with or without a reservation ID.

section.title: Servers usage (servers)
section.para: Shows server usage for a specified server.
Shows OS-SRV-USG:launched_at and OS-SRV-USG:terminated_at attributes in server responses.

section.title: Servers actions (servers, action)
section.para: Performs actions on a server. Specify the action in the request body.

section.title: Servers action (servers, os-server-actions)
section.para: Permits all users to list available server actions for a specified server. Permits administrators to get details for a specified server action for a specified server.

section.title: Servers admin actions (servers, action)
section.para: Administrators only. Performs actions on a server. Specify the action in the request body.

section.title: Servers admin password (servers, action)
section.para: Enables users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to change the password of the administrative user.

section.title: Servers backups (servers, action)
section.para: Creates backup for a server instance.

section.title: Servers console output (servers, action)
section.para: Gets console output for a server instance.

section.title: Servers multiple fixed IP support (servers, action)
section.para: Adds or removes fixed IP addresses from an instance.

section.title: Servers remote console (servers, action)
section.para: Provides interactive console support.

section.title: Servers shelve (servers, action)
section.para: Shelves running servers, restores shelved servers, and removes shelved servers.

Shelving is useful when you have an unused instance that you would like to keep for later use. For example, at the end of a work week you can shelve an instance and at the start of the next week you can unshelve it.
Your cloud provider might bill you for a shelved server.
Use the shelve action to shelve a server. All associated data and resources are kept but anything still in memory is not retained.
Use the unshelve action to restore a shelved instance.
Use the shelveOffload action to remove a shelved instance that you no longer need.

section.title: Servers deferred delete (servers, action)
section.para: Force-deletes a server or restores a soft-deleted server.

section.title: Servers evacuate (servers, action)
section.para: Evacuates servers.
Specify the evacuate action in the request body.

section.title: Servers diagnostics (servers, diagnostics)
section.para: Gets the usage data for a server.

section.title: Servers IPs (servers, ips)
section.para: Lists the IP addresses assigned to an instance or shows details for a specified IP address.

section.title: Server metadata (servers, metadata)
section.para: Lists metadata, creates or replaces one or more metadata items, and updates one or more metadata items for a server.
Shows details for, creates or replaces, and updates a specified metadata item, by key, for a server.

section.title: Servers configuration drive (servers, os-config-drive)
section.para: Shows server details including configuration drive information for a specified server ID or user.

section.title: Servers with extended availability zones (servers, os-extended-availability-zones)
section.para: Shows the instance availability zone for compute nodes (nova- compute). Internal services appear in their own internal availability zone.

section.title: Servers extended attributes (servers, os-extended-server-attributes)
section.para: Shows metadata for servers.

section.title: Servers extended status (servers, os-extended-status)
section.para: Shows extended status information, vm_state, task_state, and power_state, in detailed server responses.

section.title: Servers password (servers, os-server-password)
section.para: Gets the encrypted administrative password set through the metadata service.

section.title: Servers virtual interfaces (servers, os-virtual-interfaces)
section.para: Lists virtual interfaces for a specified server instance.

section.title: Servers extended volumes (servers)
section.para: Lists servers with attached volume information.

section.title: Flavors with extended attributes (flavors)
section.para: Shows information about flavors.

section.title: Flavors access (flavors, os-flavor-access, action)
section.para: Provides flavor access support.

section.title: Flavors extra-specs (flavors, os-flavor-extra-specs)
section.para: Lists, creates, deletes, and updates the extra-specs or keys for a flavor.

section.title: Flavors manage (flavors, os-flavor-manage)
section.para: Creates and deletes flavors.

section.title: Flavors with rxtx_factor extended attribute (flavors, os-flavor-rxtx)
section.para: Shows the rxtx status of a flavor.

section.title: Keypairs (keypairs)
section.para: Generates, imports, and deletes SSH keys.

section.title: Limits (limits)
section.para: Shows all global and rate limit information.

section.title: Guest agents (os-agents)
section.para: Creates, lists, updates, and deletes guest agent builds. Use guest agents to access files on the disk, configure networking, or run other applications or scripts in the guest while the agent runs. This hypervisor-specific extension is not currently enabled for KVM. Use of guest agents is possible only if the underlying service provider uses the Xen driver.

section.title: Host aggregates (os-aggregates, action)
section.para: Creates and manages host aggregates. An aggregate assigns metadata to groups of compute nodes. Aggregates are only visible to the cloud provider.

section.title: Availability zones (os-availability-zone)
section.para: Gets availability zone information.

section.title: Cells (os-cells, capacities)
section.para: Adds neighbor cells, lists neighbor cells, and gets the capabilities of the local cell.

section.title: Root certificates (os-certificates)
section.para: Creates and shows details for a root certificate.

section.title: Floating IP DNS records (os-floating-ip-dns)
section.para: Manages DNS records associated with IP addresses allocated by the floating IPs extension. Requests are dispatched to a DNS driver selected at startup.

section.title: Floating IP pools (os-floating-ip-pools)
section.para: Manages groups of floating IPs.

section.title: Floating IPs (os-floating-ips)
section.para: Assigns and allocates floating IP addresses to instances that run in an OpenStack cloud.

section.title: Floating IPs bulk (os-floating-ips-bulk)
section.para: Bulk-creates, deletes, and lists floating IPs. Default pool name is nova. To view available pools, use the os-floating-ip-pools extension.

section.title: Ping instances (os-fping)
section.para: Pings all or specified instances and reports which ones are alive.

section.title: Hosts (os-hosts)
section.para: Manages physical hosts.

section.title: Hypervisors (os-hypervisors)
section.para: Displays extra statistical information from the machine that hosts the hypervisor through the API for the hypervisor (XenAPI or KVM/libvirt).

section.title: Instance usage audit log (os-instance-usage-audit-log)
section.para: Administrator only. Monitors task logs.

section.title: Migrations (os-migrations)
section.para: Shows data on migrations.

section.title: Networks (os-networks)
section.para: Creates, lists, shows information for, and deletes networks.
Adds network to a project, disassociates a network from a project, and disassociates a project from a network.
Associates host with and disassociates host from a network.

section.title: PCI pools (os-pci)
section.para: Displays extra statistical information from the machine that hosts the hypervisor through the API for the hypervisor (XenAPI or KVM/libvirt).

section.title: Quota class (os-quota-class-sets)
section.para: Provides quota classes management support.

section.title: Quota sets (os-quota-sets)
section.para: Permits administrators, depending on policy settings, to view quotas for a project and view and update default quotas.

section.title: Security groups (os-security-groups)
section.para: Lists, shows information for, creates, and deletes security groups.

section.title: Rules for security group (os-security-group-rules)
section.para: Creates and deletes security group rules.

section.title: Server groups (os-server-groups)
section.para: Lists, shows information for, creates, and deletes server groups.

section.title: Manage services (os-services)
section.para: Lists, enables, disables, and deletes Compute services in all hosts.

section.title: Project networks (os-tenant-networks)
section.para: Creates, lists, shows information for, and deletes project networks.
